a management restructure involving long-time chief executive Eric Schmidt becoming executive chairman. Eric Schmidt , who has led Google since 2001, will take on the new role on April 4, working mostly on external operations, including deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership . As Google's new chief executive, Larry Page will lead product development and technology strategy, along with all day-to-day operations of the firm.
